cells.data:
First apply rotation and scale transforms by Cntrl-A, then UV Unwrapping.

In the node editor, load a tile texture then use a Texture Coordinate node with a Mapping node to scale the texture to the required size (5 in x and y in this case)





Added a glossy shader to make the tile shiny. Mix the glossy shader with the diffuse shader with a mix shader.
Set roughness of glossy shader very low 0.02. The lower the roughness, the higher the gloss.




Now I have added another Image Texture and loaded the bump map texture. Make sure to change Color on the Image Texture to Non-color data. Add a Normal Map and connect the Color connection to it. Connect the Mapping node to the Vector input on the Bump texture so that it has the same scale as the color texture. Connect the Normal Map to the Normal input on both the Diffuse and Glossy nodes.





Duplicated the Image Texture again and loaded Specularity texture. This is added to a Color Ramp and then into the Factor input on the Mix Shader. This varies how shiny parts of the floor is, and enhances realism. The Color Ramp controls how strong the effect is.
Not sure I like this, as I think it was better with a higher gloss. Will leave it for now.
